Document Sources.Sourced Statement: According to SF’s Department of Homelessness and Supportive Housing and the Human Services Agency, Los Angeles and Sacramento counties are the two other most popular California destinations.
Document Sources.Name of Source: SF’s Department of Homelessness and Supportive Housing and the Human Services Agency
Document Sources.Source Justification: Used as a reliable source for data on Journey Home program destinations

Document Sources.Sourced Statement: According to the program’s website, social services staffers verify that those who use TAP will be received at their destination by a relative, friend, or appropriate agency.
Document Sources.Source Justification: Official website providing information on program operations

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “We were dismayed to learn that our small, rural county was among the top three destinations in the state where people experiencing homelessness were sent by the program,”
Named Person Sources.Name of Source: Humboldt County officials (no specific person named in this statement, but included as it's a direct quote from the draft letter)
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Authors of the draft letter to San Francisco Mayor London Breed

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “The aim isn’t to achieve a goal. It’s to get you out of our town, and it’s cheaper than arresting you,”
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: Homeless advocate with the Western Regional Advocacy Project

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “The No. 1 answer to homelessness is to make them disappear. Then mayors write letters back and forth: ‘Stop sending your people here.’ Then it turns out they’re sending their people here. It shows the ridiculousness of us not trying to address why people are on the streets.”
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: Homeless advocate with the Western Regional Advocacy Project

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “Our TAP program works really well, and hopefully San Francisco can go back to more — not just dumping — but assisting and actually helping people get help,”
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Relevant authority on Humboldt County’s relocation program

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: San Francisco recently ramped up its effort to offer homeless people bus tickets out of town as part of its Journey Home program.
Named Organization Sources.Source Justification: Initiator of the Journey Home program

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: Humboldt County officials voted Tuesday to send a letter raising the alarm about San Francisco’s plans to bus homeless people out of the city.
Named Organization Sources.Source Justification: Affected party responding to San Francisco’s Journey Home program

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: When asked for comment, the San Francisco mayor’s office said it had not received the letter.
Named Organization Sources.Source Justification: Official response to Humboldt County’s letter
